text: Leila de Lima (born August 27, 1959) is a Filipino lawyer. She was appointed by President Gloria Macapagal Arroyo as Chairperson of the Commission on Human Rights on May 2008 and served until June 30, 2010 when she resigned and appointed by President Benigno Aquino III as Secretary of the Philippine Department of Justice. She resigned October 12, 2015 to focus on her candidacy for the Senate in the 2016 election. She is Catholic. She is a devotee of Our Lady of Manaoag. ==Sources== Category:1959 births Category:Living people Category:Filipino politicians Category:Filipino lawyers Category:People from Camarines Sur
title: Leila de Lima
